alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 11:33AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Maryland...including the following counties...Caroline, Queen Anne`s, and Talbot. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain continuing across the area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen as rain continues. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Centerville, Denton, Centreville, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Queen Anne, Starr, Jumptown, Hope, Carville, and Cordova. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
